name: Clefable

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefable's type is still Colorless.)

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Clefable during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: A timid Fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

strengths: Metronome can copy any attack without energy costs
Can use opponent's best attacks against them
weaknesses: Metronome effectiveness depends on opponent's Pokemon
Still pays 3 energy even when copying cheap attacks
synergies: Double Colorless Energy - Powers up quickly
Clefairy - Same type for consistent evolution
Scoop Up - Reset damage and re-evolve
counters: Pokemon with weak attacks - Nothing good to copy

competitiveHistory: Clefable from Jungle was popular but this Base Set 2 reprint maintained its relevance. Metronome's ability to copy powerful attacks for just 3 Colorless energy made it versatile. It could turn an opponent's Charizard's Fire Spin or Blastoise's Hydro Pump against them without the downsides.

rulings.ruling: Metronome copies the attack exactly but ignores energy costs and additional costs like discarding.
Clefable remains Colorless type even when copying an attack from another type. This affects Weakness and Resistance calculations.
If the copied attack refers to the Pokemon by name (like 'Charizard does 80 damage to itself'), treat it as referring to Clefable instead.
Metronome cannot copy attacks that have no effect when used by Clefable (such as attacks requiring a specific Pokemon type Clefable isn't).
Minimize's damage reduction applies after Weakness and Resistance calculations.
